org.javautil.util
Class MapSet

java.lang.Object
  org.javautil.util.MapSet

public class MapSet
extends Object

Utility to convert a Collection of java beans to a Map with specified key. Additional methods provide support for sorting and handling of duplicate key values. NOTE: Generics are not used in the return types of the maps, to allow for casting to the expected types. Generics may not be desirable here, as they would limit the input collections to having beans of only a single type.

Author:
tim@softwareMentor.com, bcm

MapSet

public MapSet()
Method Detail

treeMap

public static TreeMap treeMap(Collection<? extends Object> beans,
                              String keyField,
                              boolean errorOnDuplicateKey)
Translates beans into a TreeMap using the key in field keyField. A natural ordering of keys is expected as TreeMap requires it.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - when duplicate keyField values are found and errorOnDuplicateKey is true

treeMap

public static TreeMap treeMap(Collection<? extends Object> beans,
                              String keyField,
                              Comparator comparator,
                              boolean errorOnDuplicateKey)
Translates beans into a TreeMap using the key in field keyField. Duplicate keyField values will fail-fast if errorOnDuplicateKey is true. The ordering enforced by the comparator will be applied to the map.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - when duplicate keyField values are found and errorOnDuplicateKey is true

map

public static HashMap map(Collection<? extends Object> beans,
                          String keyField)
Translates beans into a HashMap using the key in field keyField. Duplicate keyField values will not appear in the resulting HashMap. Order of keys and values is not guaranteed, as per the HashMap specification.

map

public static HashMap map(Collection<? extends Object> beans,
                          String keyField,
                          boolean errorOnDuplicateKey)
Duplicate keyField values will fail-fast if errorOnDuplicateKey is true. Otherwise this method will act exactly as the two parameter version.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - when duplicate keyField values are found and errorOnDuplicateKey is true

fillMap

protected static void fillMap(Collection<? extends Object> beans,
                              String keyField,
                              Map<Object,Object> targetMap,
                              boolean errorOnDuplicateKey)
Fills targetMap using a value extracted from beans. The value is read using reflection, by reading a class field having the name of the keyField parameter. The keyField must exist on every bean contained in the beans Collection. NOTE: we do not assume that the class has a field named keyField and access it directly, rather, we invoke the getter method (which is the preferred way to access fields on cglib proxies).

Parameters:
beans - a collection of java beans to be populated into the targetMap
keyField - the class field name to be read
targetMap - the map to be populated with values from the bean collection
errorOnDuplicateKey - true If the map should fail upon encountering duplicate
Throws:
IllegalStateException - when duplicate keyField values are found and errorOnDuplicateKey is true
